articles.title: Academy Sports’ Largest Shareholder KKR To Sell Off Its 20 Percent Stake
articles.summary: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co. L.P. (KKR) is selling its entire 18.65 million-share stake in Academy Sports + Outdoors, Inc., which represents 20.1 percent of outstanding shares and is valued at $852.85 million. Academy Sports plans to repurchase up to $200 million of these shares as part of its $500 million share repurchase program. KKR, which acquired Academy Sports in 2011, will receive all proceeds from the offering, with no shares being sold by Academy itself.

articles.title: JPMorgan Chase to acquire company behind Zagat guidebook
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase is acquiring The Infatuation, the company behind the Zagat guidebook and review brand, to expand culinary perks for its credit-card holders. This move is part of JPMorgan's aggressive acquisition strategy in adjacent businesses, as regulators bar it from acquiring other deposit-taking institutions. The Infatuation will operate as an independent brand under JPMorgan.

articles.title: Bank of America taps new CFO, promotes three women to top roles
articles.summary: Bank of America announced a significant management shake-up, replacing longtime CFO Paul Donofrio with Alastair Borthwick and promoting three women to senior leadership positions. CEO Brian Moynihan also indicated his intention to remain at the helm until the end of the decade. These changes come as Wall Street banks face pressure to diversify their top ranks.

articles.title: Dell launches highly rated, $1.2 billion equipment finance securitization
articles.summary: Dell Inc. has launched a $1.21 billion asset-backed security deal, Dell Equipment Finance Trust 2021-2 (DEFT), backed by commercial leases and loans from Dell Financial Services. This transaction, structured into six tranches with high ratings, aims to mitigate concentration risk and follows a similar securitization earlier in the year. Fitch Ratings highlighted the high credit quality of the underlying collateral, with obligor concentrations notably lower than previous deals.

articles.title: Citizens Bank to acquire JMP Group in $149M, all-cash deal
articles.summary: Citizens Bank is set to acquire San Francisco-based investment banking and asset management firm JMP Group in an all-cash deal totaling approximately $149 million. This acquisition, expected to close in the fourth quarter, aims to bolster Citizens' capabilities in healthcare, technology, financials, and real estate. This move is part of a larger series of acquisitions made by Citizens this year, including HSBC branches and Investors Bancorp.

articles.title: JPMorgan Chase to buy Zagat owner in bid to boost premium credit cards
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase announced its acquisition of The Infatuation, parent company of restaurant review brand Zagat, to enhance offerings for its premium credit card holders, particularly those with the Sapphire card. This move aims to expand dining-related opportunities, potentially including access to reviews and events like EEEEEATSCON, building on successful past partnerships related to customer rewards. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.

articles.title: Software consultancy Thoughtworks eyes $6.1 billion valuation
articles.summary: Thoughtworks Holding Inc., a software consultancy, has announced its intention for an initial public offering aiming for a $6.1 billion valuation. The firm plans to sell 36.84 million shares at $18-$20, listing on Nasdaq under "TWKS." This follows a pre-IPO deal in January where it raised $720 million at a $4.6 billion valuation.

articles.title: 7 Blockchain Stocks to Buy Now For the Bitcoin Bounceback
articles.summary: This article identifies seven blockchain stocks that investors should consider as the blockchain technology market is expected to grow significantly. It highlights the expansion of blockchain beyond cryptocurrencies into various sectors like fintech, retail, logistics, and healthcare, and provides detailed financial performance and strategic initiatives for each recommended stock or ETF.

articles.title: State Street expands with buyout of Brown Brothers’ custody unit for $3.5 billion
articles.summary: State Street has announced an agreement to acquire the investor services division of Brown Brothers Harriman & Co. for $3.5 billion, aiming to expand its custody assets and enhance efficiency. This acquisition is expected to make State Street even larger globally, especially in Japan and Latin America, and integrate BBH's communications platform and 24/7 operating model. The deal is projected to yield $260 million in annual cost savings starting in the third year, despite a 3.7 percent drop in State Street's shares on the day of the announcement.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley bumps first-year pay to $110K to match Goldman Sachs
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley is raising the salaries of first-year analysts in its institutional securities division to $110,000, matching Goldman Sachs for the highest entry-level pay among major banks. This marks the second pay increase in a month for first-year investment banking and global capital markets analysts, and second-year analysts will also see their pay rise to $125,000. The move comes as other banks, including JPMorgan Chase, Citi, Barclays, Deutsche Bank, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo, have also increased junior banker salaries following concerns about work-life balance.

articles.title: JPMorgan Chase moves 1,700 employees back into Houston's tallest tower
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase has moved 1,700 employees, predominantly technologists for its Houston Technology Center, back into Houston's tallest tower. The JPMorgan Chase & Co. Tower is undergoing a renovation set to conclude in October.

articles.title: JPMorgan to Buy Restaurant-Discovery Service the Infatuation - WSJ
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has announced its acquisition of The Infatuation, a restaurant-discovery service that owns websites and apps guiding diners to local eateries globally, as well as the Zagat brand. This deal is part of the bank's strategy to appeal to high-spending customers who frequently travel and dine out. The Infatuation also organizes a biannual food festival called Eeeeeatscon.

articles.title: PayPal, Workday Lead New Names On IBD Breakout Stocks Index
articles.summary: PayPal (PYPL) and Workday (WDAY) are identified as leading growth stocks on the IBD Breakout Stocks Index, both charging toward new buy points. Their inclusion also highlights the IBD Breakout Opportunities ETF (BOUT), which is also demonstrating breakout potential. JPMorgan recently downgraded PayPal, citing a slower-than-expected turnaround under its new CEO.

articles.title: Goldman Hires Citigroup, HSBC Bankers as Mideast Deals Surge
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs is expanding its Middle East operations by hiring bankers from Citigroup and HSBC. Jassim AlSane will join as co-head of investment banking and Omar AlZaim as head of Saudi investment banking, reflecting a surge in deal activity in the region.

articles.title: Don't Fret About Small-Caps' Laggard Status, Says Strategist
articles.summary: Despite small-cap stocks, as tracked by the Russell 2000 Index, underperforming large-caps for six months, strategist Steven DeSanctis of Jefferies believes a rebound is imminent. The Invesco S&P SmallCap 600 Pure Value ETF (RZV), with its deep cyclical value tilt and exposure to economic growth sectors, is highlighted as a strong contender for patient investors to capitalize on this anticipated recovery. RZV's current valuation in the 22nd percentile suggests it's attractively priced, making its current laggard status a potential buying opportunity.

articles.title: Investors care more about fair wages for workers than environmental issues, ESG survey shows
articles.summary: A new survey by Cerulli Associates reveals that investors prioritize fair wages for workers over environmental issues in ESG investing. While environmental concerns often dominate headlines, the report indicates a significant preference among affluent retail investors for companies offering positive social or environmental impact. The survey found that 49% of respondents would invest in such companies, a rise from 43% in 2019.
